column4: I just got a Kubuntu system installed, /barely/ due to a flakey CD-ROM drive. But some things aren't working. When I boot up, eth0 is not being brought up automatically, however, lo is, and ifup eth0 brings it up. How can I fix this so that it's started at boot-time?
Mind you, this is a server install, /not/ a desktop install.
Hmm. Why? Neither of my two other computers have that. Why does that ONE need it? :)
your other 2 are magic?  i dunno. that's what works forme :]
Well.... I'll /try/ it, but I don't like inconsistancies. heh
that's the standard way to start an interface on boot AFAIK... if there's another method i'd be interested to hear about it :]
The way Kubuntu /appears/ to do it, is through using hotplug, but it's not working on that particular system for some reason.
But then again, Kubuntu and Ubuntu use the exact same installer, so they're pretty much identical in most regards.
yeah i'm not too familiar with kde...
That system doesn't even have KDE. :)
Nor X. It's a bare minimum server install.
i have reiser modules on my system... so i assume it's in the default kernel
Wow. Heh. I'm about to copy my Kubuntu installation from my testing HDD to my primary, instead of re-installing,, and noticed mkfs.reiser4.
